source.60c5a945:
test_stat, pvalue = ttest_ind(AB.loc[AB["Group"] == "A", "Purchase"],
                              AB.loc[AB["Group"] == "B", "Purchase"],
                              equal_var=True)

print('Test Stat = %.4f, p-value = %.4f' % (test_stat, pvalue))

source.ea2dbd6e:
AB Testing (Independent Two-Sample T-Test) is used when it is desired to make a comparison between the means of two groups. Normal distribution and homogeneity of variance assumptions must be met in order to apply the independent two-sample T-test (Test AB).
1. Assumption of Normality, Shapiro Wilk test is used to check.
2. The Homogeneity of Variance is assessed using the Levene test.

Implementation of the Hypothesis: Since the assumptions were satisfied, an independent two-sample t-test (parametric test) was applied.
source.42abfcba:
Normality Assumption
* H0: Normal distribution assumption is provided.
* H1: The assumption of normal distribution is not provided.
source.45b44f3a: p-value = 0.1541 then H0 cannot be rejected.
source.5089163b:
Business Problem: Facebook recently introduced a new type of bidding, average bidding, as an alternative to the current type of bidding called maximum bidding. One of our clients, abcde.com, decided to test this new feature and wants to do an A/B test to see if averagebidding converts more than  aximumbidding.
Maximum Bidding: Maksimum teklif verme
Average Bidding: Average teklif verme
source.e679d835:
Application of the Hypothesis

* H0: "There is no statistically significant difference between averagebidding(B) and maximumbidding(A)." (M1 = M2)
* H1: "There is a statistically significant difference between averagebidding(B) and maximumbidding(A)." (M1 != M2)
source.7bf5811c: Assumptions are provided, so an independent two-sample t-test (parametric test) is applied.
source.b8c3ab54:
AB Testing (Independent Two-Sample T-Test)
> It is used when it is desired to make a comparison between the mean of two groups.

1. Assumption Check
* Normality Assumption
* Variance Homogeneity
2. Implementation of the Hypothesis
* Independent two-sample t-test if assumptions are met (parametric test)
* Mannwhitneyu test if assumptions are not provided (non-parametric test)
Note:
* Direct number 2 if normality is not achieved. If variance homogeneity is not provided, an argument is entered for number 1.
* It can be useful to perform outlier analysis and correction before normality analysis.

Variables:
* Impression – Ad views
* Click – Click (Indicates the number of clicks on the displayed ad.)
* Purchase – Indicates the number of products purchased after the clicked ads.
* Earning – Earnings after purchased items
